Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: "Before Ray began to understand the world around him, he had already forgotten his mother's face."}
{3: 'From very early on, he was raised by his father and grandma.'}
{3: 'His grandma has always lived in the shadow of hatred.'}
{3: 'She says that the Punishing Virus has taken everything from her.'}
{3: 'How did it exactly?'}
{3: 'Ever since he was born into this world and opened his eyes for the first time—he did not know.'}
{3: 'The world was already like this.'}
{3: 'But everyone always tells him that the world should not be like this.'}
{3: 'That machines should not attack humans. That those towering builds used to be our homes.'}
{3: 'Mankind had spread to every corner of the Earth, conquered the highest mountain and reached the deepest trench.'}
{3: 'We were just shy of leaving this planet and spreading our footprints across the cosmos.'}
{3: 'We should not be like rats subsisting in the dark corners of an apocalyptic world.'}
{3: 'However, he had never seen that bygone era. All that remains in his hands are the vestiges of the past.'}
{3: 'Perhaps, not even that.'}
{3: 'Should he be filled with hate? Toward whom?'}
{3: 'People do not blame landslides, earthquakes, tsunamis, and the cruelty of nature.'}
{3: 'When something has become a part of this world, it is no different from natural disasters. The Punishing Virus is no different.'}
{3: 'Ray has only seen this world, so he has naturally accepted all of its cruelty.'}
{3: 'Deep within his memory, he sees the blurry image of a woman hugging him and humming an unknown song.'}
{3: '—A lullaby.'}
{3: "At least that's what the people of the Golden Age called it."}
{3: 'The lyrics have been lost to time. All that remains is the melody.'}
{3: "It's like a gentle stream of warm and tender feelings."}
{3: "That's the last sound left by his mother."}
{3: 'Only from that lullaby could they feel the last bit of warmth from their past.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory320.png'}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: '...Daddy. Where are you?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: "Daddy, I'm scared.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: 'Daddy...', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory289.png'}
{2: 'Red Tide Illusion', 3: 'Ray...'}
{3: 'Hearing the familiar voice, the boy hurries in the direction of the tide.'}
{3: 'The sound of waves is close at hand.'}
{3: 'As if within reach.'}
{3: 'But before the boy can get close to the river, a magnificent and loud sound masks his "father\'s whispers."'}
{3: 'A slender female shadow looms above the Red Tide.'}
{3: 'He stops in his tracks.'}
{3: 'Hearing the words contained within the "song," the boy burst into tears.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory316.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "Lee, you're back. Where's the commandant?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'What do you mean, "gone"...? Where did the commandant go?', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'To search for the source of the Red Tide with the Strike Hawk.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "...I can't let the commandant go alone.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'And with that, she prepares to leave.'}
{3: 'Only to be stopped by Lee.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "That won't be necessary. The commandant isn't alone. The Strike Hawk is there, too.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Wanshi? That makes me feel a little better, but if it's just the two of them...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Lee, can you explain?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "The commandant wouldn't just leave without a reason. I wanna know why.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Lucia, Liv, the commandant orders us to wait here.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Why? Aren't the Gray Ravens a team?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "And with the commandant's current state...", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'The fact that Gray Ravens will always be a team is precisely why we are staying.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Lucia, you were confused once, too. I'm sure you trust the commandant's intuition.", 4: '2'}
{3: "Lucia's concern begins to subside."}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Because there are things that only we can do here.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Because... everyone else is here...', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Exactly. If we went with the commandant, we wouldn't be able to help if disaster strikes.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Whether that be gathering everyone together, protecting them, or buying enough time for the commandant.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Are you worried? Are you afraid of being court-martialed with the commandant?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "No, of course not. I'm just worried about the commandant's safety.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "But I trust the commandant's judgment.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Let's use this time to do what the commandant wants us to do.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory317.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: 'Chief Commander Hans.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "You're... Gray Raven?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Correct. I'm the Gray Raven's technical support Construct.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'If you have any issues, speak with your commandant instead of reporting directly to me.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'I hope the Gray Raven Commandant taught you all proper chain of command.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'I know the proper "chain of command," but special circumstances have left our commandant indisposed.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Indisposed? What do you mean?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'The commandant has already left.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Come again?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'The commandant has already left to find a child named Ray.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'When did the commandant leave?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Not too long ago. I disassembled the functional part of our bit domain node and gave it to the commandant to be deployed.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "If I understand you correctly, the Gray Raven Commandant is blatantly violating my orders, and you are an accessory to the commandant's disobedience?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "I don't think seeking a solution to our current predicament is in violation of your orders, sir.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "As far as I'm concerned, you only came to tell me that you are going to be court-martialed together.", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Chief Commander, we came here hoping that you would reconsider the strike plan in favor of a precision strike that would wipe out the Red Tide and protect the refugees without the need to relocate them.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "If you have such a plan, I'm all ears.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Not yet, but I specialize in problem-solving. Chief Commander, please allow me to—', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Hans forcefully interrupts Lee.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hans', 3: "If that's the case, then quit wasting my time.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'You disappoint me. I was already perfectly clear with your commandant. Either they leave or die. There is no third option.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Your only mission is to evacuate the refugees before Babylonia activates the Longinus Arsenal. Unfortunately, your "efforts" have yet to yield results.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'A flurry of footsteps approaches, causing Lee and Hans to turn and look.'}
{3: 'Lucia and Liv bring the refugees to the field before Hans.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hans', 3: 'Two more Constructs? Are you playing games with me, Gray Raven?', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Chief Commander, I beg you to listen to what the refugees have to say.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "They've already been loud and clear. They refuse to leave and want to await death.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "No, that's not it, sir. They are just sad, angry, helpless and desperate.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Chief Commander, please pardon my audacity. But... have you ever been betrayed?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "As a soldier, I'm sure you vehemently oppose betrayal.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'No honest man tolerates betrayal.', 4: '2'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'What would you think if you and your comrades were surrounded on the battlefield and the commander ruled that sacrificing your troops was beneficial to the war effort?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "I would not call it a betrayal. If sacrificing myself would lead to victory, I'd gladly die on the battlefield.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Exactly. Every soldier in Babylonia is willing to sacrifice their life for a distant victory.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'That is how we are educated. That is why we understand that this is what we were born to do as soldiers.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'But what about civilians? Not everyone can or must understand the meaning of a distant victory. Nor will they be willing to sacrifice their will to achieve it.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Do we not stand here to protect the free will of the people?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'In the situation I just described, if your troops are protecting a group of people, and the commander orders them to be abandoned, what would you do?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Would you abandon them and allow the enemy to kill the civilians you were protecting?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Or would you order your troops to fight to the death?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Soldiers must protect civilians. However, if they can fight to protect them and choose not to, that is betrayal.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Quit trying to strawman me.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Lucia', 3: '"The World Government Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act" should only apply to civilians of the World Government. In doing so, you regard them as comrades. Do you not?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Chief Commander, take a look. These are the people under your protection.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "They are parents, spouses, children, and siblings. They've done nothing wrong.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'But they have been met with disaster. They have only one small wish, which is to protect their home until the very end.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "The commandant went to find the child out of sympathy for the child's crying grandmother. She can be saved just by reaching out with a helping hand.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "Enough. Give it a rest. You've already wasted enough of my time as is.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "This isn't the first time I've been in this situation. I've witnessed countless people during the Great Evacuation beyond my saving.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'At that time, the horizon was painted red by countless who perished. The only chance of survival was up.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Hans', 3: 'The laws of war are complex yet simple: all factors can be quantified into the addition and subtraction of effective strength. The first party to have their effective strength reduced to zero will be declared the loser.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'We can think about feelings, but war will not, and neither will the Punishing Virus.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'In our war against the virus, the only thing we can do is try our best to preserve our effective strength.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Some people call us hypocrites, but only those who survive are qualified to criticize hypocrisy.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "You see someone crying for their children in front of you, but if you don't stop the Red Tide from entering the ocean, millions more will cry for their children.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Are you capable of protecting each and every one of them?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Do you have the ability to save everyone every time you encounter a difficult choice?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "This is the first time you have been faced with such a choice. Isn't it?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "And this won't be the last time. I guarantee you that.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory316.png'}
{3: 'Despite being barricaded outside by the Constructs guarding Hans—'}
{3: 'Liv remains persistent.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'This is cruelty!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Chief Commander Hans, please reconsider. Not for glory or for faith...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'These meaningless deaths are unreasonable and avoidable.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Chief Commander, we are soldiers. We stand on this land in order to protect our comrades.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Whether that be the people of Babylonia or the people on Earth. We are comrades.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "We shouldn't turn our weapons on those we should be protecting.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Construct Captain', 3: 'Chief Commander, did you hear what I said?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Did you say something?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Construct Captain', 3: 'We received a transmission from Team 07.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Construct Captain', 3: 'They have deployed their bit domain node.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Construct Captain', 3: "We have deployed our node. The Red Tide's tributary is still some distance away from us.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Construct Captain', 3: "We can't guarantee that the Red Tide won't flood the area within Babylonia's next orbital cycle.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Construct Captain', 3: 'Now is the optimal time for activating the node.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Construct Captain', 3: 'Do you want to authenticate and activate the bit domain nodes now?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Construct Captain', 3: 'Chief Commander?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Before he could finish talking, a cry interrupts him.'}
{3: 'Behind the dunes of yellow sand, a thin figure walks toward the camp.'}
{3: "The woman on the verge of collapse rushes forward. After seeing the boy's face, she slaps him, kneels down in the sand, and hugs him tightly."}
{3: "Noticing that the boy shows signs of corruption, Liv rushes forward, injects a serum into the boy's arm, then quietly steps aside."}
{3: 'The boy feels a stinging hot sensation on his face before he can even process what has happened.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Refugee Child', 3: 'Sorry... Granny.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: 'I was just so scared... I wanted to find Daddy.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Woman', 3: 'Ray, your daddy...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: '...I found him.', 4: '2'}
{3: "The woman just takes this as the boy's overactive imagination after being frightened."}
{2: 'Woman', 3: 'Really? Where did you find him?', 4: '1'}
{3: "But so what? Now that it is over, there is no need to correct or shatter the boy's dream."}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: 'Yeah. He was in that r-red water.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: 'I heard Daddy.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Woman', 3: "What'd he say?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: 'He said—', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Refugee Child', 3: '"Take care and live a long life."', 4: '2'}
{3: "The woman's eyes open widely."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory69.jpg'}
{3: 'She instantly recalls a memory long ago.'}
{3: 'Before all of the tragedies, the newborn child rests in her arms, so fragile but so full of hope.'}
{3: 'She kisses her baby on the forehead, then says the same thing to him.'}
{3: 'It all seemed like just yesterday.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory316.png'}
{3: 'She turns to face the Constructs of the calibration team.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'No resentment, no hatred—she had exhausted all her emotions. Her voice was hoarse from crying, like a mother bear that had lost her cub.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Standing off to the side, Liv instantly understood the reproach within her eyes without uttering a word.', 4: '1'}
{3: "—Why didn't you come sooner?"}
{3: 'At that moment, Liv gets choked up with an overwhelming sense of guilt and empathy.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Why didn't we come sooner?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'If we just came here earlier... just a little bit earlier...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'If only I had come here sooner...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'If only I was a bit stronger...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'If only I could bear some of their agony...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Would I have been able to prevent this from happening?'}
{3: 'But how much earlier?'}
{3: 'A few days? Weeks? Years? Before the the Acadia Evacuation? Or before the ensuing collapse and chaos of society?'}
{3: 'No one has an answer to this question.'}
{3: 'No one can answer this question.'}
